では、サナダムシはフグ以外の魚にも寄生するのか。
実は、サケやマスなどのサナダムシの幼虫は、イヌ、ネコ、ヒトなどにも寄生します。
サケなどの魚類に寄生していた幼虫が、魚を食べたヒトの体内に入り込み、そのまま成長してしまうこともあるのです。

Iris Recognition - News, Research and Innovations
Iris recognition is an identification method that uses the distinctive pattern of colorful dots found inside the iris – the coloured portion of the eye. It is a non-intrusive biometric method, which means it does not require the use of contact lenses or surgery to obtain a reading. The FBI has reported that it is “the only 100 per cent acceptable form of individual identification.”
Today, iris recognition is used in airports, border crossings, government buildings and embassies, financial institutions, check cashing locations, healthcare facilities, and more. It is also part of law enforcement and criminal justice operations, including surveillance, fraud detection, suspect tracking and identification, and database interrogation.
Futurismo has compiled current iris recognition news, research, and innovations to illustrate how this emerging biometric technology is impacting various industries and improving our way of life.

The invention relates to a handpiece and a motor, which is provided with a rotor of magnetized material, a stator fixedly arranged around the rotor, and a coupling device which connects the rotor to the stator and enables relative rotation therebetween.
2. Description of Related Art
EP 1 882 665 A1 discloses a handpiece that includes a drive motor provided with a rotor of magnetized material, a stator fixedly arranged around the rotor, and a coupling device which connects the rotor to the stator and enables relative rotation therebetween. A rotation shaft projects from the coupling device and is connected to a drive mechanism of the handpiece. The drive motor is integrally formed with the handpiece, wherein the handpiece can be manufactured in a single piece by injection molding. The handpiece has a housing part and a bearing part which is connected to the housing part, in which case the bearing part is formed at a base end of the rotation shaft. The bearing part can be manufactured by injection molding independently of the housing part, wherein the bearing part is subsequently connected to the housing part. 「北方領土」とは、北海道の東北に位置する4島のことです。日本が領有権を主張していますが、ロシアが実効支配しています。
歴史的には、1855年の日魯和親条約によって、日本が択捉島とウルップ島を領有しました。その後、1875年の樺太・千島交換条約によって、ロシアが樺太を日本に引き渡す代わりに、日本がクナシル、歯舞、色丹を引き渡すことになりました。しかし、第二次世界大戦後、ソビエト連邦が崩壊すると、ロシアが南樺太と千島列島を占拠し、北方4島の帰属を争うことになりました。

1. Field of the Invention
The present invention relates to the use of collagen peptides in the preparation of active immunization strategies. More particularly, the present invention relates to the use of collagen peptides to elicit cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs) specific for both self and foreign antigens.
2. Background of the Invention
Immunization with a foreign antigen can elicit protective immunity against subsequent exposure to that antigen (foreign epitope). Immunization with an endogenous self antigen (autologous epitope) may induce immunity to that antigen, as well as cross-reactivity to foreign analogues of that antigen. Induction of self- and foreign epitope-specific CTLs by collagen peptides has been disclosed. Immunization with collagen peptides has been demonstrated to induce both self and foreign epitope-specific CTLs.

1. Field of the Invention
The present invention relates to an antenna used for wireless communication or the like and, more particularly, to an antenna of a planar inverted-F configuration.
2. Description of the Related Art
In recent years, antennas of a planar inverted-F configuration have been used for wireless communication devices and the like in place of antennas of a helix configuration in consideration of miniaturization and cost reductions thereof. An antenna of a planar inverted-F configuration is formed on a substrate and has a feeder pattern formed on the substrate to feed a feeding point formed on the substrate with a signal, and a ground pattern formed on the substrate to ground the feeding point. The ground pattern is connected to the feeder pattern via a via hole formed in a dielectric body provided on the substrate. The ground pattern and the feeding point are electromagnetically connected to each other via a resonator electrode formed in an island pattern on the dielectric body.
With such an antenna, the signal fed to the feeding point is transmitted and received via electromagnetic induction from the resonator electrode. In other words, the signal flows from the feeding point to the resonator electrode and is transmitted and received via electromagnetic induction from the resonator electrode. Conventionally, as a method for producing a laminate ceramic green sheet used in the production of a multilayer ceramic capacitor, the following method has been used (see Patent Document 1, for example).
First, a paste containing a binder, a solvent, and a conductive powder (hereinafter, may also be referred to as a “first paste”) is printed onto a surface of a nonwoven fabric using an extrusion coating machine to form a first conductor pattern. 1. Field of the Invention
The present invention relates to a chair tray which is used for placing a beverage cup or the like thereon and can be stably placed on any flat surface.
2. Description of the Prior Art
A chair tray for placing a cup of tea or coffee thereon is conventionally known, in which a tray part is formed in a substantially U-shaped form and a supporting part is connected to one end of the tray part. This chair tray can be placed on a flat surface by bending the supporting part and placing the tray part on the flat surface. However, such a chair tray is not suitable for stably placing the tray part on a flat surface because the supporting part needs to be further bent when the tray part is placed on the flat surface, and thus it is likely that the tray part would slip from the flat surface.

「大きいことはいいことだ」。これは、小さいことや些細なことを否定し、大きなことや物事を肯定する意味で使われる言葉です。日本では、江戸時代の教育方法である「武士道」の中にこの考えがあると言われています。
もともとは、19世紀初頭にアメリカの宣教師が日本人に教えたと言われている「大きいことはいいことだ 小さいことは悪いことだ」という言葉が変化してできた言葉です。
現代では、以下のような意味で使われることがあります。
・大きなことを成し遂げた人や物事を肯定する
・大きなことを成し遂げた人や物事に対して尊敬や感心の気持ちを表す
・大きなことを成
